heading: Whole Page Content
summary: Fast free track transfer from Ukraine to Romania, via Moldova supported by UNHCR and IOM Learn more The Romanian and Moldavian governments, with the help of the UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR) and the International Organization for Migration (IOM), have organized safe and free transportation from the Ukrainian-Moldovan border to the Romanian border for all people fleeing the war in Ukraine. Regardless of nationality, anyone can use free transportation services. Direction: daily buses depart from the Palanca border in Moldova to the city Huși in Romania. Travel time: 5-6 hours. In Huși, if required, you can get free medical care, water, food. Then you can take free buses to Bucharest or Iasi. Learn more
